column4: I'm having some difficulty setting up a dual boot system. I have two hard drives and I'd like to set up Linux on my Master, XP on my Slave. Is that possible or should I install them both on the Master in order to dual boot?
Well, XP is not loading from GRUB. I'm concerned that since it's a drive that I have to mount once I've loaded Ubuntu, maybe it's not being looked at for Grub?
So Ubuntu on slave and XP on master?
what's your configuration of drives?  what types of drives, whats on each drive?
I'm not sure how you mean "configuration". They both have a single partition. One has Ubuntu, one has XP. The one with XP is a Seagate Barracuda. I'm not sure what the other is.
I meant drive interface type, IDE SATA etc.  Better question is how old are the drives?
I'm trying to figure out if there's any BIOS issues here
hence my questions
both of them>
it should be detecting, which drive is GRUB installed on?
if Windows drive has the boot loader on it, set it to master, then set the other to slave
whichever has grub on it should be the master, the BIOS will see it first
if its not detecting Windows, it means there's issues with your drives, have you updated GRUB's list lately?
lets try this, boot to only one of the drives (Disconnect the other)
whichever one has grub on it should be master
other should be slave.'
the other issue is if GRUB can see the drive...
if the computer boots to the drive individually, then the issue lies not in drive issues, but GRUB issues...
you might look into updating the GRUB list hold on a sec...
try in console: sudo update-grub, not sure if it will update GRUB's lists of partitions
then perhaps its stored on the Ubuntu drive
you need the Ubuntu drive in as well, the bootloader files are stored on there
good to hear
